website_summaries.verdict: This key lock box hangs on doors or hooks for easy access around the home.
pros: Lock box keypad uses a simple 4-dial combination set to access the interior lid
Can stand the abuse of outdoor weather without rusting or losing its integrity
cons: Large items like car keys may be more difficult to store in the small interior container

customer_reviews.title: Do not trust with house keys! How-to videos on picking this lock available online.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely do not use this for keys that secure anything of value, especially your home! There are videos of how to easily pick this lock available online and it can happen to you. I cannot stress this enough. Last night we awoke to an intruder in our home who had cut this off our main gate and opened it (likely following the easily googled how-to videos), using the keys inside to enter our home. Luckily no one was hurt, but trust me that you never want to experience that situation yourself. Find another solution if you're looking to store your house keys for use by others, preferably one that the entire Internet doesn't know how to open!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Pirkowski

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Design & Engineering
customer_reviews.text: Bought the lock. Put on a sturdy pipe, put key inside, closed & locked box. A few short weeks later, and hey, the darn thing has been peeled like a banana!!! Needless to say, changing my door lock cost me $112. The problem is with the dust/weather cover. If you punch it out, there is a nice gap where a prying tool can be inserted. Wham, no more locked, secure house/apartment key. Poor design!!! NEVER buy this lock!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Swooper

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: This is a review to the product and not Amazon. I bought and used this to leave key for realtor to show property. However, lock was clipped easily and appliances were stolen from home.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE AND BROKEN INTO TWICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these Master lockboxes thinking it is the best lockbox out there, but the first one jammed on me in the winter time. The 2nd and 3rd were broken into by being smashed or pried open with something!!! See for yourself, here are pictures of the last 2 I owned which were broken into!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Great illuminated key lock box-Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: The key lock box is working fine. It is easy to line up the numbers. The illuminated dial is great. I spray painted it white and it blends with a house better.-less noticeable. I Really appreciate the weather protection cover because it also makes a more attractive package for the front entrance area.
customer_reviews.author: RickWAllen

customer_reviews.title: KEY CODE WOULDN'T UNLOCK, A FEW HITS WITH A ROCK EASILY BROKEN IN TO
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in November (7 months ago). We were locked out the other day, and attempted to open our lock box to get the spare key. The key pad code would not unlock the lock box (yes, I'm 100% sure what the code was). Fortunately for us (in this situation), a few blows with a big rock busted the entire box open...not exactly the security we were looking for. Batting .000 on the two necessary features of a lock box.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hoffmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Should be 5 stars but and it's a HUGE but
customer_reviews.text: It works great but what's frustrating about this version is the person who returns the key and closes slot needs to remember to spin the combo so that the next person doesn't know what it is. So with the Accesspoint combo push button - pictured below - its not a possibility to reveal combination :) Hoping someone at Master reads this and makes a version like that...
customer_reviews.author: LeeRon

customer_reviews.title: Nice light, but can’t open the box.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this becuase i thought the light was a great idea. The light works. I can easily enter the right combination if/when I get locked out at night. BUT THE BOX WON’T OPEN. Latch moves freely. Right combination is entered. BUT THE BOX WON’T OPEN. Tried greasing it, wiggling it, etc etc. Nothing works. Fatally flawed design.
customer_reviews.author: LDY

customer_reviews.title: Works for most people, not all
customer_reviews.text: Easy-to-use device with a decent mechanical combination that will deter most folks. But it fits only on doorknobs, not door handles, and an alert bad-actor will recognize that they merely need to slip the box off the handle and take it home to use a sledge-hammer or angle grinder, at their leisure, to get access to the key. Should I hide it in the bushes? Seems to defeat its usability. I use it for my AirBnB folks, but never leave it on the door for more than a few hours. I think of ways to secure it, but I didn't think that I'd need to limit my use from the beginning. Limited device, not a sophisticated deterrent.
customer_reviews.author: John Maliga

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and weatherproof!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lockbox outside for awhile now and its held up well in rain. No rust or any signs of wear and tear. The key itself shows no signs of rust as well which is a really good sign.
customer_reviews.author: Ada Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great overall key locker.
customer_reviews.text: We rent out our beach house, and can not always greet incoming guests. This seemed like a perfect solution, as we had seen them on properties we had visited, as renters, on vacation. They are quite heavy, and the code combinations are very easy to set/change. The key chamber is substantial enough to hold several keys, on a ring. The one area where it loses some points, with me, is that the rain leaked into all three of the chambers, in the lock boxes I bought, and mounted. Luckily, I am there, frequently, so I could hand dry the interiors. If someone were to be around, less, there would end up being rust in the chambers, and on the keys.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID P FROST

customer_reviews.title: LOCKED ME OUT!!
customer_reviews.text: What a horrible terrible product!!! I am not a rough or careless person when handling tools or objects, but this lock ended up locking ME out of my own place. This happened because the combination got magically changed when I opened the hook to hang it on the front door. The button to reset the combination is VERY sensitive and it will “record” whatever scrambled number you happen to land on. It’s ridiculous! I ended up having to change my whole door lock because of it. What a dumb design. Thanks for nothing!!
customer_reviews.author: Camille V.

customer_reviews.title: Not really anti-theft proof
customer_reviews.text: There are ways to open these thing, even there are videos on YT how to do it. luckily i used it only for emergencies for something that is not really that important so I'm ok with it. I put some keys and a 10dollar bill inside, after rain it got wet. So it might be a good idea to check it if it got wet. Dry it properly so things will not get rusty or smelly inside.
customer_reviews.author: GeEmWae8

customer_reviews.title: It's no Fort Knox, but it'll keep honest people honest
customer_reviews.text: Bought this lock for a house we were fixing up to sell. We had already moved, but we needed a way for cleaners, painters, and repair men to get in and out of the house without just stashing the keys under a rock. Queue this handy thing. It's cheap, and anyone determined to spend 10-20 minutes fiddling or about 10 seconds with a hammer could probably get this thing open without issue, but to protect an empty house from squatters and looky loos, it works like a charm. Just don't put the thing on backwards. It is not forgiving, and it shouldn't be. You'd have to be daft to do that by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: This is my third time buying this lock. I don’t know whether they subbed it out to a different manufacturer or they just decided to lower the quality, but there’s a distinct difference between the one I just received the previous ones. This does NOT work: it won’t close, it won’t open, it’s just a big headache. You can tell it’s different because the logo has a different look to it.
customer_reviews.author: LaserGuidedArtTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Useless and worthless
customer_reviews.text: This is a waste of money. I had a pet sitter try to help me because the lever would not work to even set the lock. She regularly uses them and could not get it to function properly. It entailed an unexpected trip to Home Depot to buy a better lock box. What a pain. Cheaply made and basically worthless. I had a similar lock box in the past and it worked. This one did not work from day 1. Don’t waste your money. Home Depot had a better one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Werner

customer_reviews.title: This is the best locking key box!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I use mechanical locking key boxes in addition to electronic-type for real estate listings. This is the best mechanical box I have ever used and reasonably priced. Ordered this to initially trial inside an unlit storage shed as a key locker for power equipment and am wickedly impressed. Ample space in the compartment, easy to set unique unlock code & unlatch/attach shackle. The lighted numbers make visualizing combination much easier no matter the lighting conditions. The design is durable, and the cover keeps the mechanism clean and presentable. We will be purchasing more for our real estate listings.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Love them (I have 2 now)
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use and change the combination to anything you want it to be. Caution: Save some time and read the directions. It makes it easier. I used it on a house I was selling. The person buying the house put their own lock/keyholder on the door when I took mine off. It was exactly the same. This guy flips houses and uses the same thing. I guess it is pretty popular. It also has the cover to protect the dials from the weather. I also have one of these outside my house hanging on something other than the door. This is much better than leaving a key under the mat. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and works great! Plenty big
customer_reviews.text: I love that it stays unlocked and you can close it locked or not. I actually used mine as a gate lock, but cutting a 2" hole in the back of this and mounting over a hole in my gate where I can reach the latch. The end result is that you can't get at the latch unless you have the combination, but I can go in and out my gate without keys. I'm going to get a second one and put it on a second gate where the pull string is how you get in from outside (I'll put this where the pull string is inside, and you need the combo to pull the string).
customer_reviews.author: The big Lebowski

customer_reviews.title: We had to cut it open to get our keys out.
customer_reviews.text: After about 5 uses, this completely broke and we had to cut it open to get our keys out. There was no evidence that someone tried to break it open, and we definitely had the right code, it just wouldn’t work. From the beginning the buttons seemed to have an identity crisis about whether or not they were to go all the way down when pushed... sometimes they did, sometimes they went half way... it just seemed to not work from the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff Waters

customer_reviews.title: Great for back up or shared keys.
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect solution for back up/lock out keys or keys shared with others. I use this lock to make my key available to caregivers. I like that I can easily change the combination if we change caregivers. The unit hangs around a round doorknob without interfering with turning. If you have lever door handles, you can order a separate adapter to make this item compatible.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Key fob and cover
customer_reviews.text: Works but two issues to know about: 1) a plastic key fob and one, maybe two regular keys will fit, but they have to be strategically placed inside or the chamber will not close. 2) The little plastic cover that slides down to protect the combination wheels will slide down if it's being shaken or vibrated. We had ours attached to the frame of our camper and this happened. A piece of duct tape to hold it in place is probably necessary, but shouldn't have this issue for a lock this expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Vhuber101

customer_reviews.title: Lock to hold keys
customer_reviews.text: My parents forget their keys sometimes and was keeping a spare wrapped up in paper by the door. I thought that was just inviting a burglar in, so I bought this for them to hold the spare. Pretty easy to set the 4 number combination using the instruction sheet attached. I circled the two parts in the picture and sent it to my dad so he can reset his own combination and attach this to their window. There’s room in the lockbox for more than just one key. Worked out well so far. I’ve even benefited when I went to their house to drop something off and forgot to bring the front door key.
customer_reviews.author: BubblieTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my RV.
customer_reviews.text: I ran across the idea of attaching this to a certain area of my trailer to store an emergency set of keys so I wouldn't be stranded away from home if they were locked inside either the trailer or my tow vehicle. This is really great because it uses a numbered code to unlock the key storage rather than needing another key. It gives me peace of mind because I actually ran into a situation out of state when my car key (fob) wouldn't start my car because the battery power was low. I would have been in a pickle if I wouldn't have had a second set of keys on me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak shackle
customer_reviews.text: I own a private garage with 3 motorcycles a KTM DUKE 390, A MT-07, KTM 500 EXC SIX DAYS LIMITED EDITION MY FREINDS HARLEY DAVIDSON BREAKOUT. MY DADS CBR 600RR 2016 AND MY 1988 HONDA CIVIC..Unfortunately i would be scared to death to use this for my garage. The shackle is so flimsy that with one good hit with a hammer the thing would fly right off..The shackle is being held by a c pin?? Naaa ill pass..i love my valuables..im actually surprised masterlock would put out cheap crap. Lol maybe its meant for lighter use..
customer_reviews.author: michael rivera

customer_reviews.title: Failed to open with code!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an AIRBNB guest house July 2018. It malfunctioned and would not open with the code 6 months later. A huge embarrassing inconvenience! We had to use a sledge hammer to get the key out. Should have taken a picture!! If you can’t trust a Masterlock....??? Will not buy another one. Have read about other failures also.
customer_reviews.author: Patty RN

customer_reviews.title: Only buy if you never have to use it
customer_reviews.text: Well 2 weeks after using this it's locked shut. At some point getting our key out the code managed to change. Of course it's screwed on the wall and now useless. Opened this probably everyother day because our keys are always on a different floor and we out this right next to the door
customer_reviews.author: Erin M

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than a new window
customer_reviews.text: This has helped as a backup for when someone has forgotten their key. It was also useful when we forgot to give a family member a new key after re-keying the locks. They were able to call us for the code and get the spare key. There isnt much space inside, but more than enough for a key and maybe a few other small items like a folded bill. Not bit enough for a credit card, and i dont think even a very small knife would fix, but basically you are buying this to hold a spare key, so you should be good a standard house key (a car key with a large keyless entry fob would not likely fit).
customer_reviews.author: Sam Mercer

customer_reviews.title: I feel at ease now 🔑
customer_reviews.text: I locked myself out of our place one time and never wanted that to happen again so I got this and I feel worry free knowing there's an extra key waiting for me in the lockbox right at my door. It's really easy to use. There's a black screen hiding the 4 number code, you pull that down, put in your numbers and push down on the black switch to the left of the numbers and the box opens. It's definitely worth the peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Emily H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for extra set of keys in case you lock yourself out!
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than a locksmith if you lock yourself out... and safer than a key under the mat or in a fake rock. The lock is sturdy and would require bolt cutters to remove from the door. I feel better having it. You can set and reset the lock combination so can be used again and again. Perfect if you have a weekly rental or real estate agent and need to leave keys for someone to access. This hangs on the doorknob and does not get in my way of using my keys or opening/closing the door.
customer_reviews.author: Leahcat

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget Lock Box on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: I work in the field of real estate and when I sell properties this has been a lifesaver! A lot of the time agents will not have access to a supra box so these come in handy as they only require knowledge of a four digit code which can easily be added to showing instructions on a listing. I will say that some of the time the latch mechanism can make it somewhat difficult to push back closed (opening it is usually very easy), but aside from this the unit is very sturdy and I feel safe placing it on the doors of the properties we are selling.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce R.

customer_reviews.title: PROVIDES ZERO SECURITY
customer_reviews.text: For a Master Lock product it was very disappointing. Once you open the lock box you can change the combo or release the shackle...NO TOOLS or anything else required. So if you give someone the code to the box they will be able to change the code and remove the box. There is even a tab INSIDE the box that says reset. This box has ZERO security features - might as well just put the key under a rock.
customer_reviews.author: CMP

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT RECOMMEND IT AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: If only I could give negative star rating. What a piece of cr*p! It stopped working within 1 month of use, I WAS ABLE TO UNLOCK IT WITH A WRONG CODE/COMBINATION EASILY (just forced it a little WITHOUT TOOLS even), reset lever stopped working at all during first 2 weeks, there are enough videos in internet on how to pick it up AND IT’S SO EASY TO DO... Never ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Yulia

customer_reviews.title: Great if you lock yourself out a lot
customer_reviews.text: Do you lock yourself out often? Cause I do. I couldn’t find a good spot to hide a key outside. We have this at the salon I work in, and I use that for my key at home. It’s neat!! I don’t panic and try to find someone in town with a spare key. I have cameras too so I can see if someone comes and goes and opens my doors or windows. Sensors all around. So, I don’t worry too much about weirdos.
customer_reviews.author: Fatima Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I used this to lock a spare key for emergency entry at a relatives. Simple set the code to the last four of the phone number, and any family memeber can locate the box and get in. That worked great. After opening the box 3 times the code no longer works and the box is locked to the plumbing. If I had time I would follow a simple video for breaking into it. Not worth your time or money. MasterCrap should be the name.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Parker

customer_reviews.title: If Your Daughter's a Blonde
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the lock box to put on the door knob. You can set the number to whatever you want and the numbers are pretty big. So, you could use her birthday or just 0000 or something she might be able to remember. For my blonde daughter, I chose 1234 because she seemed to be able to remember that. She couldn't remember her birthday because there are zeros in it, and she couldn't remember which digit repeated four times for something like 2,2,2,2 or 3,3,3,3
customer_reviews.author: DrJohnsonCom

customer_reviews.title: New but Defective, company didn't offer to exchange it. 1 star for customer service :(
customer_reviews.text: I ordered several of these for work, set the combo, tested it and put it in the drawer till we needed it. Only 2 months later (Amazon returns or exchanges for up to 30 days) I went to use it and it doesn't work, defective ugh! . I called the company directly hoping they would exchange it, even though the man I spoke with was nice....nope I just have to toss it in the trash and buy a new one. Guess I'll be trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jenks

customer_reviews.title: Great for key fobs
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these for renting Turo cars. They work great and are one of the few models I've found that have a sufficiently large internal compartment to hold a modern car key fob and comfortably fit some other larger car keys. I live in Colorado and have not had any issues with snow/ice/rain whereas I had another model freeze. The only drawback is having the dial system because numerous people don't spin the dials when they take or return keys. Anyone could walk up and steal the keys and/or lockbox. Obviously this applies to any lockbox with this design, but the button push models take up more space and have a relatively smaller internal compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: We got tired of having to worry about keeping a spare key under a fake rock or somewhere else a robber could get to, so we invested in this and locked it to our iron security door. It's been outside for a year and still works as well as the day we purchased it. It's also nice if we have someone coming over we can just give them the code to get to the keys instead of having to worry about distributing spares to any friends/family. Plus we can change the code if we don't want someone to have access to them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Singleton

customer_reviews.title: Not really sure..  Maybe its a fake?
customer_reviews.text: So I use it to store my apartment keys in the basement of my building. I got locked out once and figured it might be a good idea to get one of these. I have another one of these at my parent's house that I bought at home depot which is why i say it might be a fake. The two of them seem to be made of different materials and the combination dials feel different. Maybe master lock changed their materials or maybe this is one of those sweet fakes.. Everything gets cloned.... Its the world we live in ...
customer_reviews.author: Juan J.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient.  Easily Defeated
customer_reviews.text: This is super convenient. There is a YouTube video detailing exactly how to make a metal tool from a soda can with kitchen scissors. it verifiably works. Accidentally set a random code first day. Discovered this video and was back in the box in minutes . Great for me to have working access again but also worrisome that I could crack it within 60 seconds after watching a YouTube video
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kershner

customer_reviews.title: great place to store a spare key
customer_reviews.text: i debated about where to hide a key outside. i did research and found that most thieves had the same ideas. someone recommend this product. it has a combination lock that u can easily program, it is sledge hammer solid, and stronger than wood door jambs. so a burglar has a better chance of breaking into your house than the do of getting your spare key out of this lock box. i highly recommend this solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Poppert

customer_reviews.title: I think its a good lock
customer_reviews.text: Its very easy to use but I had to buy a second one because after several showings the door became jammed and could not remove without force, not sure if it was the lock or one of the prospective buyers, trying to pry open the cabinet to get the key but I'm buying a new one in hopes it wasn't a faulty lock and was an over zealous renter instead, because I like it and its easy to use and program new combinations.
customer_reviews.author: Kitena Suttles

customer_reviews.title: Lock combination got changed somehow.
customer_reviews.text: At first it worked fine. Somehow a month later, the code got changed or the lock won’t open. No one messed with it to my knowledge but me. I bought it because I needed a spare key for my rental as a backup for my August lock. I chose this lock because of the light option. Now I’ll have to figure how to open it and reset the combination.
customer_reviews.author: thuy payne

customer_reviews.title: Good old fashioned mechanical key-safe.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is STRONG! You would need a sledge hammer to get it open, and it would probably destroy the key in the process. It sure beats all the well-known (to burglars) methods of hiding the key. I will no longer get locked out of my own house, with no one home, and still in my jammies - how embarrassing that was! Good thing it was summer... I would have been in real danger if it happened in the winter-time. Get it - you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Rock Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my Mom's front door as suggested by paramedics. Mom has dementia and poor health and paramedics have been called to her house a few times for various reasons. Mom is alone at times while my brother is at work. The paramedics advised us to either hide a house key outside somewhere OR, put a Lock Box on the door--otherwise they need to break down the door to reach Mom. First thought was to ask a realtor friend how to obtain a Lock Box. Second thought was to look on Amazon as they have almost everything! Duh. So glad to have found this item. My brother installed it with no problem, no complaints (and he's NOT very handy!!!).
customer_reviews.author: Sandy15172

customer_reviews.title: doesnt lock
customer_reviews.text: i entered my new combo, closed it, and scrambled the first three numbers (the last one was sticky). i noticed that as long as the last number was correct the rest of the numbers did not matter. i tested my theory by scrambling all and as long as i reurned the 4th wheel to "3" the lock would open no matter the other numbers. that means a thief can guess the combo by just using last wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Bre

customer_reviews.title: Solidly made!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to secure our house key. I liked that with the loop you could secure it to an object so someone couldn't take it home, break it open, then return with the key. It comes with instructions and was easy enough to program. I think you have to snap the loop part back in before it will allow you to lock the door back. You can program a four-digit code on the lock.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren G

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough to fit all smart key.
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about a year now and works great still. We use it to hide our key after surfing so it probably got some salt water on it over the year but no sign of rust and still working great. Compared to our last lock box the wheel for the number turns smoothly, locking mechanism is easy and operate. My only complaint is that it is not big enough to fit all smart keys. It won't fit my Toyota smart key but it's fine for a 20% smaller Honda smart key.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Lock box simply wouldn’t open with correct code 4 months after purchase resulting in an Airbnb disaster costing me the entirety of the stay.
customer_reviews.author: Terry T

customer_reviews.title: Not large enough for car keys
customer_reviews.text: While the dimensions of the box seem big, the inner lock mechanism takes up a fair amount of that space. I bought this lock box to store car keys (key + fob) and it's only barely possible to do so after several minutes of trial and error. Not something I want to go through each time, so I'll be returning the lock box. When I came out on a cold day, it was also difficult to push down on the release button, which makes me worried what would happen further into winter.
customer_reviews.author: matryoshka_ira

customer_reviews.title: Great for unexpected emergencies!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to keep a key handy for unforeseen circumstances. I bought one last year for a lady I take care of because her life alert had signaled a fall and the fire dept was about to bust her door down to get to her. It was suggested by one of the fireman and they actually used it just a few weeks ago when the same thing happened. You can have the code on file with emergency services so they can get inside without damaging property. I’m now using this one for my dad’s house. Fast shipping and much cheaper on amazon than the hardware stores.
customer_reviews.author: marsha m

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I needed it for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock to hold keys to other locks while I was on a cruise. When we went to the beach I was told to lock up your bookbag while in the water. So I bought little pad locks and locked up my bookbag. Well I didn't want to have to keep up with the keys so I bought this product and stored the keys in there and it worked like a charm. I am glad I found this. Now I will say it is heavy but that was not a deal breaker for me!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Hooks

customer_reviews.title: Good lock for AIRBNB hosts
customer_reviews.text: it's a good lock. I used it for Airbnb guests and I got 5 stars on check in process. If you forget the code, you're kind of screwed though. There's no key-bypass system or anything. Inside the keyspace, there are levers to open the whole lockbox and also to change the code. I would recommend putting some black tape over those labels so you don't have a dastardly airbnb guest change up the code on you.
customer_reviews.author: Mashfik A.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for its intended use.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good security. Yes I know that its possible to be broken into, as is any lock but not something I worry about so not sure why some reviews mention that. You see these things everywhere so that means something. That they work great for their intended use. Plenty of space for many keys or even other small objects. I used to allow contractor access into houses I renovate. I have the non-shackle version that bolts directly to a wall on my own house.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: This Lock Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I used to keep my truck key in my baggies pocket while surfing. After losing the keys while surfing on a very cold windy day and having to freeze until another surfer came in so I could call my wife to bring the spare, I decided to get this lock. I never worry about not having a key for my truck now. I have one on both trucks now. I highly recommend this lock to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Surf-Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this one winter, but so far it's working perfectly. I've already needed to open it once to avoid having someone drive across town to pick up keys during an emergency, and it worked perfectly. Locks easily, opens well in winter, and has a decent capacity for a few keys which should be enough for most household needs. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Providential

customer_reviews.title: Master combination lock, wall mount
customer_reviews.text: I love this security lock. It is not too big, no batteries to fool with easy to change the combination, has a cover for the numbers. feels heavy duty. Price was great. It was almost half price of the one I saw at a store (Lowes). The screws to attach it are long enough to go through exterior wall (T1-11 siding) to a stud. Perfect for holding extra keys.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Sharp

customer_reviews.title: No more making a million sets of house keys.
customer_reviews.text: Good for keeping a set of keys secure. Now my relatives can easily get in if there is an emergency or we go away for vacation, etc. The people we dog sit for have this so I got one because it worked so well. So much better than having to make a set of keys for every family member. Now you can just give them your secure code. Easy to reset and change the password from the inside anytime you want. Also good for if you get locked out etc.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Chrapuch

customer_reviews.title: Must-have!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this! As are my parents, who recently drove 2 hours to my house only to discover that they left their key to my house at home. Excellent way of letting contractors or neighbors into your house when you're not home without giving them a key, and without spending $$$$ on a fancy keyless entry system. Love that you can change the combination whenever you want.
customer_reviews.author: Rach9276

customer_reviews.title: Completes its job.
customer_reviews.text: Seen some reviews complaining about the security, not sure if that was a bad batch they got because mine is fine and locked in tight for security. Solid product and happy to be using it today in 2019. - easy install - easy setup - Can tough the weather and extreme heat (Nevada Desert) - Would buy this again if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and sort of safe
customer_reviews.text: I am so, bad at locking my keys in the house. I get in a hurry and close the door and in that instant I realize oh no, I left my keys inside. Now with this my key is outside protected and this is a great protection box. Well made and easy to use. Oh, sure there probably is someone that could open it or hack it but, there is always someone able to do that no matter what you use. There will always be someone that can undo what ever you do. For me this works and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: B. ColemanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for after school kids!
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly for our family. Our preteens are forever losing and forgetting their house keys and can’t get in the door after school. This way, the whole family knows the code and everyone can get in when they need to. We have also been able to give the code to grandparents, a babysitter and a pet sitter. It makes coordinating visitors much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great for life alert or similar situation
customer_reviews.text: We installed this so that emergency services that are partnered with security agencies that go to peoples houses when a fall alert is detected can get inside the house. Our company knows the secret location of the lock box and code so that when they send firefighters/EMTs to the house, they dont break down the door. Much better and secure than "hiding" a key under a potted plant.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Kasper

customer_reviews.title: Works great, serves its purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item when we started renting out our spare room as an Airbnb. It comes with very simple, easy-to-follow instructions on how set the code. It's very easy to change, and can be changed again at any time. When it unlocks, you open the little door on it and there is room for several keys (or whatever else). No complaints! Functions exactly how it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had this installed in my vacation house. Absolutely amazing and easy to use. Also, easy to install. My guests always had a problem opening the lock box. This one was easy and it also lights up at night.
customer_reviews.author: Mob

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LOCK BOX!!! Strong, heavy and holding up to weather
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lock for a while now and I will say it's been a great buy! The lock itself is extremely strong, it does have good weight to it and it is easy to set and change your pin codes. It is holding up to the elements so far although it isn't in direct contact with snow and rain. I will be buying a second lock to keep extra keys in the garage entry, just in case we lock ourselves out or lose our set of keys. It'll be cheaper than calling a locksmith!
customer_reviews.author: Yvette L

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: The whole thing was stolen within two weeks of placing it on a secured metal pipe. I guess they cut through the upper part? I thought these things were indestructible but my property manager told me they regularly get stolen. Now I have to worry about someone having my spare set of keys. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: julia goolia

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We put this outside with an extra key to our property. It was easy to set up and easy to hang on a wooden fence. I tested it when we first put it up and it worked perfectly. Haven't been back since we hung it to try to get into it again, but it's still hanging there, so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: mscheirer

customer_reviews.title: Leaked like a sieve. Rusted and stopped working within a year.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this lock box for use with a dog walking service and set it up on the fence outside of my building. Setting the combination and storing keys was very easy. Before long, I noticed standing water inside of the lockbox. I cleaned it out, made sure it was closed snugly and the cover was closed over the combination dials. Water still gets inside on a regular basis, and I've had multiple people call me because they were unable to open the lock box. I will have to move on to a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Rupp

customer_reviews.title: Great lock but don't buy it here USED!
customer_reviews.text: I like this wall key lock box rather than the ones you hang on the door handle, but DO NOT buy 2nd hand from Amazon. Two times I have to end up returning them bc they kept sending me ones that had changed combos and were locked not allowing me to set my own. Amazon QC should check their return products or contact Masterlock manufacturers to reset it before re-selling them as "good NEW condition" to save a few bucks. I got so fed up that I ended up buying it from another supplier and it worked perfectly the first time!
customer_reviews.author: hchou

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof, but does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid lockbox but its not weatherproof. Water definitely got inside and the keys rusted. Programming was easy and locking and unlocking was easy. It holds a lot of keys, as I had about 8 keys in the lockbox and there was room for more. Overall, it does what it is supposed to do, but it's definitely not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: APKP

customer_reviews.title: Master Lock 5400D
customer_reviews.text: The Master lock box ( 5400D ), is convenient and serves the purpose of protection from the obvious. Don’t hang the lock box, on the door knob. Find a place that is convenient for you and the person who needs to gain entry. Share the 4 digit code with the person of your choice and no one else. Use a couple of squirts of lubricant every so often, to keep metal parts flexible.
customer_reviews.author: winifred barnes

customer_reviews.title: Out of towner padlock
customer_reviews.text: I’ve noticed this padlock being used by local real estate agents. After trying it for a couple of months, I had to buy another. I travel every other month and use this on my home front door. Sometimes I need my assistant to come pick up some supplies from my home or a friend stays over to house sit. This simple gadget gets it done without hassling me. It’s easy to lock, weatherproof, fast installation and you wouldn’t miss it. I guess what can beat this would be those Wi-Fi operated locks. With an affordable price and ease of use, this is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: AFPJ

customer_reviews.title: Lock it up.  Very good item.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lock-box for a small umber of keys that was convenient and as small as possible. After looking at the options, I came across this one and decided to buy it. First off, this is pretty compact, which is great. This is about the size of a average hand palm. Terrific. Second, the combo deal works well. Setting a new combo was very easy and this holds probably 50-6 keys without a problem, which was perfect for my needs. I should add that the keys had a small label with them so it does hold enough for what I would imagine is a typical need. Overall: This is very nice and worshippers well.
customer_reviews.author: Narut Ujnat

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but big...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my house key to be accessible but this is too large and very visible. This is great for realtors but I only needed it for one or two keys to be accessible for my family in the event of an accident. I was unable to get up for over 2 hours from the floor and if I had fallen no one would have been able to get in to help me. Every home should have one of these somewhere for their extra keys.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sharma

customer_reviews.title: My favorite contractor lockbox
customer_reviews.text: The price here is about $10 less than the big box hardware stores. I love these boxes. They are sturdy, easy for people to use, and they last a very long time. The extra space inside allowed for me to properly mark the keys and prevents the jamming in sometimes get with my smaller ones. These are the only that I buy now.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Lynn

customer_reviews.title: I bought two and they both jammed!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Airbnb vacation condo and use a lockbox to let people in. I'm not always able to be near the property when they check in. The other day I had to drive an hour and a half to let them in myself because the lockbox was jammed. I couldn't get the thing to budge. It was as if the combo had changed. I had another one just like it and set that one up. I opened and closed it a couple of times, no problem. Went to open it one more time, jammed! Just like the other it won't budge. This product is not reliable!
customer_reviews.author: DavyB

customer_reviews.title: Great Lock
customer_reviews.text: Solid lock and easy to reset password. Great product with accurate information and real user feedback. Scored an A using Fakespot. Check out the app it’s worth it. Amazon allows fake feedback. They could stop this because they have the technology to do it but don’t. It affects their bottom line. So do a little research first and save your time on returns and money.
customer_reviews.author: Allie Rae

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended for RVers
customer_reviews.text: I have used this lock for ten years with my RV Travel Trailer. I use it to store extra keys to the trailer doors, truck door and ignition. The lock is attached to my propane tank to which I have access without a key. The lock is sheltered but does get some road mist during rain day travels. It has worked perfectly for over 70,000 miles. That's a lot of vibration and jostling for any key safe. Highly recommend this key safe for travelers. Update One Year later. Still working fine. After now 11 years I took it home and cleaned it up. Added a tad of WD-40 to the working parts as a precaution. 5 plus stars still
customer_reviews.author: R. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Really useful for inside key storage
customer_reviews.text: We were using this inside the house to lock a key for the kids tablet locker. I love it because we were able to mount it on the wall right by the locker so the key is near to hand and doesn’t get lost. The only issue I have is that we wanted to put a hook inside to hang the key.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Makes it very convenient to have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Makes it very convenient to have a guest come by my house without having a doorman. The lock at the top makes it easier to put this lock box in inconspicuous places such as behind an outside door or on a rail tucked away from the elements and strolling pedestrians eyes. I would not leave it out with a key while unused since I'm not sure about rusting and the dials. I had an issue with the passcode combination and the manufacturer was very kind and helped me out through the entire purchase. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Grungy

customer_reviews.title: Never expected to need this
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would need this. It fits nicely on a gate. We were having guests and they needed access when we weren't there. Later a neighbor heard noise in our place and this gave her the ability to check it out. Nice appearance. Good solid. Reviews and price point better than most. I never thought this would be useful but it has turned out to be a wise purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sushicatlover

customer_reviews.title: For mom's apartment
customer_reviews.text: Ended up needing a variety of caregivers, PT and OT for mom after a fall. Used this to put an apartment key in and allowed the caregivers to get in with ease. Mom too hard of hearing to hear them knock and unable to get up easily to let them in. This was perfect solution. Door was on an interior hallway, so we had no weather related issues.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Jammed and couldn’t access.  READ REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: Jammed and couldn’t access. READ REVIEWS- better to get a lock box with punch in numbers. I am most certainly not the only person who had this issue. I always use the same combination for locks, and had used this one before when suddenly it stopped working. Luckily it was jammed BEFORE I went to use it rather than after I had locked keys inside like several other reviewers. Indoor use only. REALLY disappointed in quality- expected better from Master Lock.
customer_reviews.author: Kate P

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver...don’t be locked out!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a condo and have a Kwikset keyless entry. There have been times when I couldn’t get into the apartment (low battery, stuck buttons) so storing a house key in the Masterlock safe is a lifesaver! I put the Masterlock safe around the water pipe to my condo in the stairwell. I got the idea from a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Mary

customer_reviews.title: Solid design, easy and intuitive to use.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a good lock box for a vacation rental. This box is strong, well constructed and easy to use. The wheels turn easily and the outer shackle opens with a small lever. There is plenty of room for locking around a doorknob. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dave K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Realtor and Contractor
customer_reviews.text: This device is perfect. Allows the Realtor the freedom to NOT have to be there at the premises to let the Contractor in and out. Also, no less, it allows the Contractor the freedom of NOT having to keep track of a dozen keys of different jobs he has to be at any time. Perfect! Amazon, as usual, perfect too in their packaging and on-time deliveries.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I can’t speak to durability, but we’ve had multiple times our builder needs to get in our home and we have to struggle around our work schedules. We trust the builder implicitly and can now leave him a key. Nice for house sitter, dog sitter. I can change the code at any time, so I can make it the last four digits of the person’s cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: HospiceRN

customer_reviews.title: Works but its not hard to break open
customer_reviews.text: It works but they jam in about a year exposed to weather (prob sooner if exposed to more precipitation). When mine jammed o googled how to break into it. Having zero lock picking skills it took me 7.5min to rip it open. So it works, but anyone who knows their stuff can pick this in under 2 min.
customer_reviews.author: NotMyRealName

customer_reviews.title: Great Key Safe
customer_reviews.text: I have my shed and backyard fence locked up, and a neighbor kid who cuts my grass. I keep a set of keys in the lock-box, and when he comes over, he has access to the key to get to backyard and supplies. Also, the Comcast and AT&T boxes are in my backyard, and because my backyard is locked, My next door neighbor has been able to let them in when needed. Its helped make our life easier and safer. The Lights for the dial is perfect. I've needed to get into the shed ad night, and now i don't need a flashlight to figure out the combination.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonshopper3263

customer_reviews.title: Not for cold climates!
customer_reviews.text: At first this appeared to be exactly what I was looking for. It's basic, but does the job. However, after spending 6 weeks away from home in VT, in the middle of Winter, it took over an hour, in the freezing cold wee hours of the night, to de-thaw the lock and get into my house. The little plastic "window" designed to keep out the elements is completely useless. The lock was placed on a door which has major overhangs and a large tree which kept away the snow and rain, so it wasn't actually getting wet directly. It was a rather frustrating experience and I would suggest anyone living in cold climates avoid purchasing this product
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: It was stuck once and I had to push hard the release button with a screwdriver and made that work. But now it’s stuck again and it doesn’t work. My keys are inside and now I have to change my lock and keys. Worst padlock ever.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Great, dependable lock set
customer_reviews.text: I have much better piece of mind with the Master Lock Set! It's a great way to let in housekeepers, petsitters, and early-arriving guests when you're not home. I also have a tendency to misplace my keys, and this is a great way to ensure that I never lock myself out of my house. Setting the lock code was easy, and opening the set is also super easy. I highly recommend this set!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Musselman

customer_reviews.title: No more pots!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a more secure spot for the spare key. No more pots! This does the job and we don’t keep too much in there. The u-lock is narrow so keep that in mind in terms of where you place it. We struggled a bit with a very slightly wide banister outside but we made it work.
customer_reviews.author: Widget

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just not big enough for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I have a toyota key which has a key and fob built in together so the base of the key has the fob on it. This key would not fit in the box and let me close and lock the door. Everything else about the box I love. The weather tight door is genius. The way you are able to reset the password is vary user friendly. Great product. I just wish master lock sold a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: Great security
customer_reviews.text: When my mother needed a sitter, I really didn't want to start giving out door keys. This was the perfect answer. Now the door key is AT the door whenever we need it! The combo lock is easy to set, and it's easy to use. Not only do the sitter and I use it, but I know if Mom ever needed emergency help, they could find out the combination and get in to her quickly and easily!
customer_reviews.author: Suzette G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this lock. The dial pad has a cover over it. I’m assuming that will delay the rusting which is exactly what occurred with my prior lockbox. This lock has a very sturdy shell. So far so good. Easy to program also
customer_reviews.author: doreen sobers-stewart

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE LOCKS!
customer_reviews.text: As a broker, it is important to have a lockbox that works right EVERY TIME. This is one of the ONLY lockboxes I know that works well each time. The unlatching mechanism can be VERY difficult to "flick" in the winter time, but otherwise a great product. I would recommend putting this somewhere away from the elements, or where the elements are few.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Good for Airbnb
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I rent out a room on Airbnb, so this is a nice place to store a key when we are not around to let someone in. It is easy to change the combination, and it is durable lock. I have noticed during heavy rains, that water can get inside, although this does not affect the actual working of the lock, you might want to know.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

product_meta.title: Master Lock 5400D Set Your Own Combination Portable Lock Box, 5 Key Capacity, Black
product_meta.description: Style:Portable| Pattern Name:Key Lock BoxThe Master Lock 5400D Portable Lock Box features a 3-1/4in (83mm) wide metal body for durability. The portable design offers removable “over the knob” installation. Set your own four-digit combination for keyless convenience and increased security. The shutter door protects combination dials from weather, dirt and grime; and molded body and vinyl coated shackle prevent scratching. The Limited Lifetime Warranty provides peace of mind from a brand you know and can trust.
feature_bullets: Large capacity key lock box enables secure storage of up to five standard (2 in.) house keys; Shackle fits most ball, biscuit, and tulip door knob styles
Set your own four-digit combination lock box; reset the combination for thousands of personalized combination code options
For indoor and outdoor use; key safe is constructed with a metal body for durability, vinyl coated shackle to prevent scratching, and shutter door to protect combination dials from weather
Exterior dimensions: 4 in. (10.2 cm) H x 3-1/4 in. (8.3 cm) W x 1-3/4 in. (4.4 cm) D; 13/32 in. (10 mm) diameter shackle with 1-13/32 in. (36 mm) L, 1-7/8 in. (48 mm) W
Capacity for 5 standard (2 in.) house keys; Interior dimensions are shaped like an ""L;"" Top section measures 0.3 in. x 1.56 in. x 2.95 in; bottom section measures 0.95 in. x 1.51 in. x 3.21 in.
Lock box combination is preset to open on 0-0-0-0. Combination reset instructions included with product.

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
